tntstagram: While the generous response to the bushfire crisis is brilliant, would there be as much international generosity and news coverage if this crisis was happening in a less developed country that has less resources to deal with their own crisis?  Cyclone Idai smashed into south-eastern Africa, killing thousands in what some called the worst weather-related disaster ever to strike the southern hemisphere. Food donation left to rot in Zimbabwe. A month later Cyclone Kenneth hit the same area causing another 50 deaths. There was an international response, nothing on the scale of the international attention and generosity currently directed towards the Australian fires.
